Abstract.AbstractText: Riesman's sign or Snellen-Riesman's sign is a clinical sign characterized by bruit heard over the closed eye with a stethoscope in Graves' ophthalmopathy (thyroid eye disease or Graves' orbitopathy or thyroid-associated orbitopathy) in thyrotoxicosis. The bruit is audible during systole.
